snippet: Hedge funds aim to reap high returns while countering volatility in stocks, but during the global turmoil in August, many just extended their history of underperformance.
abstract: James Stewart Common Sense column says average hedge fund fell 2.2 percent in August; observes funds dropped average of 3.5 percent over past 12 months; points out that despite their underwhelming performance, institutions keep investing lots of money in hedge funds.
lead_paragraph: Hedge funds aim to reap high returns while countering volatility in stocks, but during the global turmoil in August, many just extended their history of underperformance.

headline.print_headline: Hedge Funds Faced a Test This August, and Faltered
headline.main: Hedge Funds Faced a Test in August, and Faltered

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies
